The subchronic administration of the oil for 28 days led to an increase in the glucose and cholesterol levels in the female rats. Moreover, the essential oil had no effect on the serum triglyceride level in the rats. A previous subchronic toxicity study of the M. piperita essential oil also revealed a significant rise in total cholesterol, triglyceride, and high-density lipoprotein in rats.
17 The difference between our results and those previously reported in the literature may be due to dissimilar components in the different Mentha spp.
